Topic.Title: Poll: Will Yahoo shareholders get $3.6 Billion returned to them this year?

Message.Msg: It would seem to make some sense to first do a share buyback, and then later announce a dividend on the remaining outstanding sharers. The share buyback would initially strengthen the sp. A one time 'special' dividend and/or even a continuing quarterly dividend, if substantial enough, could then trigger a round of short covering and serve to at least discourage some future shorting. Then worry about buying new opportunity assets possibly with shares which are more fairly valued. Maybe a win-win. JMO. Cheers...

Topic.Title: Yahoo Meeting Monday To Explain $3.6B Cash Return To Yahoo Shareholders

Message.Msg: No $28 long has yet been able to show anyone how giving away money in going to add value to Yahoo and raise the stock price. $16.37 last month and struggling in the 15s today after the last nonevent; cash from Alibaba Group that they said would drive the stock up. The $28 longs often have trouble explaining the magic of how an event that does not add any value to Yahoo is going to move the stock. And notice that they always have a new deadline for the big day when Yahoo will pop and erase shorts. Gets boring after over 4 years.

Topic.Title: Yahoo Meeting Monday To Explain $3.6B Cash Return To Yahoo Shareholders

Message.Msg: No $28 long has ever been able to show anyone how giving away money is going to add value to Yahoo and raise the stock price. They still can’t and all have quit asking them to. Gets boring after over 4 years.

Message.Title: IMO---New factors will launch YHOO very near term
Message.Msg: a.) Beginning of 4th qtr, Money managers will certainly want to own Yahoo for the expected appreciation so talked about and in place now----my sense is $ 19-$22 range by year end allowing for a nice slow but steady accretion of the potential of Yahoo, my estimate a minimum 25% in next 90 days to be in their portfolios. b.) Yahoo management may, possibly this week, signal a major change in corporate programs----inclusive of new alignments or product enhancement. c.) The direction of the programs to: a.) share buyback w/dividend program, b.) sharebuyback alone( not the best) or c.) a one(1) time cash distribution ( liquidating dividend) plus insight as to future programs. we could see if Yahoo is under a new program, IMO, relatively near term buying many more shares monday

Message.Title: Why can't Microsoft find analytic talent?
Message.Msg: The claim by their general counsel that they can't find enough data and software engineers is bogus. In my blog post, I provide 6 reasons why MSFT can't find analytic talent, and how to fix theses issues. To read my article, do a Google search on "Why can't Microsoft find analytic talent?" Vincent Granville, Ph.D. (cell) 925-759-7308
